column1: #Text=A NEW ROUTE ACROSS SCOTLAND Leaving Tigh na Cruaiche we reached the shooting lodge without difficulty , and by and by saw King 's House Inn which was plainly discernible from its white-washed walls , and being also the only house visible ahead of us .
#Text=It is worthy of note that in our journey from the Dee to Glencoe we did not meet a single person , a circumstance which well shows how peculiar our route was .

#Text=Yet every part of the way was enjoyable , much of it exceedingly so ; even the Moor of Rannoch was enjoyed because of its extreme ugliness , and its utter want of pretension to be considered beautiful .
